duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform basic automotive services in the shop area, including tire service and car service duties.
Repairs and balances tires, operates tire changer, handles air impact wrenches, and changes tires in the service department for Boss’ cars based on sales mix.
Performs lubrications, oil changes, basic vehicle inspections, and elemental mechanical tasks following BSRO inspection and recommendations procedures.
Unloads and loads items from trucks, maintains service center standards of cleanliness, and complies with company safety policy and federal/state OSHA safety requirements.
Drives vehicles to deliver merchandise, move Boss’ cars, and interacts with Bosses in a non-sales capacity.
Perform 0 to 3 flat repairs per day, mount and balance 4 to 28 tires per day, and rotate wheels on 1 to 7 vehicles per day.
Engage in cold work environment in the winter with a cold cement floor, hot work environment in the summer, and exposure to a variety of chemicals used in cleaning, lubrication, etc.

education_certification.credential: Reading and writing, ability to learn basic mechanical tasks, and valid automobile driver’s license at all times.
